Description: Clay sealing; circular with curved base. Inscribed in simple angular script on four sides. Six-pointed star in the centre; accidentally baked.
Curator's comments: This is one of three seals, two of which are in the British Museum, with a third in the Ashmolean Museum (Kalus 1996, no. I.4.1: 45). Like 1893,1111.1, the Ashmolean example was acquired by the Rev. Greville Chester in Egypt and came into the Ashmolean collection in 1891. All three were clearly struck by the same die; none has yet been satisfactorily deciphered.
Bibliographic references: Porter 2011 / Arabic and Persian Seals and Amulets in the British Museum (2)
